item.title: Rustç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡â€”â€”æšä¸¾
item.description: åŸæ–‡é“¾æ¥ğŸ”— Defining an Enum å®šä¹‰æšä¸¾ Where structs give you a way of grouping together related fields and data, like aÂ RectangleÂ with itsÂ widthÂ andÂ height, enums give you a way of saying a value is one of a possible set of values. For example, we may want to say thatÂ RectangleÂ is one of a set of possible shapes that also includesÂ CircleÂ andÂ Triangle. To do this, Rust allows us to encode these possibilities as an enum.
